image.altText: Sebastian Johnston is grinning

props.synopsis: After waking from a week-long induced coma, Sebastian Johnston was diagnosed with epilepsy and an acquired brain injury. Now he is calling for more understanding for young people living with the condition.

title.children: People living with epilepsy can 'slip through the cracks', advocates say

image.altText: Two firefighters stand on a creek bed with a fire hose jetting into the creek. They are surrounded by blackened trees and grass,

props.synopsis: South Australians are being urged to take care with campfires over Easter, as the fire danger season is extended for the Mount Lofty Ranges. Beachgoers are also being warned to assess local conditions as an algal bloom persists along parts of the coast.

title.children: Easter travellers warned of fire danger, algal bloom

image.altText: Two teenage boys stand wearing red sports uniforms at dusk.

props.synopsis: Junior players of a traditional Indian sport are allowed to compete at the Australian Sikh Games for the first time in the event's 37-year history.

title.children: Youngsters to compete in ancient sport for first time at Sikh games

image.altText: A farmer stands on a piece of rusted machinery in the middle of a farm

props.synopsis: Despite applying for government drought funding months ago, one South Australian farmer says he is still waiting for assistance.

title.children: Farmer waits on drought relief payments for months

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: Matthew Draganoff is standing trial accused of the shooting murder of his tenant, Simon Middleton. Prosecutors allege there had been an "accumulation of grievances" that led to the crime.

title.children: Man allegedly murdered tenant over 'growing animosity', jury told

image.altText: People wait to board a train pulling into a station.

props.synopsis: Adelaide public transport users continue to pay maximum fares for short trips three years after Labor returned to government, despite its former treasury spokesperson labelling it a "blatant cash-grab" when the Liberal party axed it in 2019.

title.children: No return to two-section fares in Adelaide despite 'cash grab' claims

image.altText: Willie Rioli carries two football bags at training

props.synopsis: Port coach Ken Hinkley labels racist abuse directed towards Willie Rioli as "a disgrace", as the Power forward returns to training after being granted a day off.

title.children: Rioli returns to Port as coach labels racist attacks an 'absolute disgrace'

image.altText: A QantasLink plane on the tarmac

props.synopsis: Passengers out of SA's biggest regional city could soon see a spike in flight prices as more airports are forced to bring in security screening.

title.children: Mount Gambier airport passengers face 'unsustainable' $90 fare hike

image.altText: Stella  hugs her daughter as they walk along the footpath outside the District Court

props.synopsis: A woman who was abused at the hands of her ex-partner – a former police detective – says she felt "silenced" after reaching out to SA Police, a court has heard. Their daughter also recounted his abuse and said she no longer considered him her father.

title.children: 'I will not be silenced': Woman confronts abusive ex-cop husband in court

image.altText: A flood approaches a small outback town surrounded by a levy

props.synopsis: Emergency services say road closures around the remote South Australian town of Innamincka are likely to be in place for months, prompting concern about the local tourism industry.

title.children: As floodwaters recede, Innamincka locals face long wait for roads to re-open

props.synopsis: The prime minister has appeared on many podcasts this year to make his case for re-election. It turns out the firm quietly facilitating these appearances was a left-field choice.

title.children: Company linked to Betoota Advocate to run PM's re-election podcast strategy

image.altText: Aerial view into a car showing a driver resting a mobile phone on their lap

props.synopsis: Police have issued more than 46,000 fines in six months to Adelaide drivers caught using mobile phones and are "disappointed" at the number of repeat offenders – including one driver detected 41 times.

title.children: Driver caught on mobile phone detection cameras 41 times

image.altText: Albanese and Dutton stand at separate podiums on a tv set.

props.synopsis: The second debate revealed an opposition leader still trying to trade off voters not feeling better off than they did three years ago and a prime minister not able to answer all the questions about how he would improve underlying problems in the economy.

title.children: When the debate turned to Trump, a gap emerged between Dutton and Albanese

image.altText: Anthony Albanese shakes hands with albo in the studio

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese traded blows on cost of living, housing, climate and dealing with US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Dutton admits second mistake, and other takeaways from ABC Leaders Debate

image.altText: A red chart tracking stocks falling

props.synopsis: While the past few days has seen calmness return to markets, many of the financial world's best minds fear further falls — and warn we're nowhere near the end, unless America backs away from its current policy. One analyst warns we're witnessing something not seen since the Great Depression.

title.children: Market meltdowns may have been a trial run, insiders warn

image.altText: A man stood on rocks on the edge of the ocean

props.synopsis: Australia's weather will be firing on all cylinders this Easter long weekend, with a cyclone in the north, powerful swell in the east and a swing from hot to cool in the south.

title.children: Easter weather brings a cyclone, swells and temperature whiplash

image.altText: Pedestrians overlaid with stock market boards

props.synopsis: Australian shares ended the day higher, as the latest labour force data shows employment increasing by 32,000. Wall Street fell again, as tariff fears continue.

title.children: Australian share market closes higher following jobs data — as it happened

image.altText: A foreign airline passenger is greeted by a Customs and Border Protection Officer at an immigration desk.

props.synopsis: Immigration lawyers provide advice on US travel, as border security officials conduct "enhanced vetting" of travellers with broad powers to refuse any visa holder entry.

title.children: Travelling to the US? Immigration lawyers suggest using a burner phone

image.altText: A beach with rocks on it.

props.synopsis: A 54-year-old man has died despite frantic efforts to save him after he was pulled from the water unresponsive at Bawley Point on the NSW South Coast.

title.children: Easter tourists warned to avoid unpatrolled beaches after swimmer dies

image.altText: Gavin Newsom in a black shirt standing at a California state lectern raising both pointed index fingers while next to Rob Bonta

props.synopsis: The United States' most populous jurisdiction, California, and its Governor Gavin Newsom are suing the Trump administration in a lawsuit aimed at blocking President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs on foreign trading partners.

title.children: Californian Governor Gavin Newsom sues Trump over 'destructive' tariffs

image.altText: Brooke Kerton and her partner Jesse

props.synopsis: Advocates admit co-operative housing models are not for everyone but say for the right residents, they offer more security and affordable pricing than traditional rentals.

title.children: Shared living model offers hope amid rental housing crunch

image.altText: A hand holding two green avocados with blemishes over a pile of avocados.

props.synopsis: In the heart of WA's prime avocado growing region, a former engineer is turning formerly rejected fruit into sought-after oil.

title.children: Smashing use found for Australia's tonnes of wasted avocados

image.altText: A 17-year-old with large headphones resting on his shoulders poses for a portrait in front of his gaming PC.

props.synopsis: Popular video games are utilising harmful tactics to trap kids into spending more cash and more time gaming, a new consumer report finds.

title.children: 'Gambling without limits': How video games are fleecing kids

image.altText: cinema seating covered in popcorn and flour, with a caution sign strewn on the floor.

props.synopsis: Enthusiastic eruptions from audiences during a viral moment in the film create a mess for staff to clean up, but could the viral trend be a good thing for cinemas?

title.children: Cinema sees $50k in damage to screen after Minecraft movie showing goes wild

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal rangers sitting in a shed in plastic white chairs, surrounding a map of the region.

props.synopsis: A live fire mapping service, used by Indigenous rangers, firefighting agencies and pastoralists in northern Australia, is on track to run out of funding during the region's peak fire season.

title.children: Vital firefighting tool at risk as northern Australia enters fire season

image.altText: Side profile headshot of Basil Zempilas smirking

props.synopsis: The WA government describes a call by Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas for Perth to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games as a "brain fart" and a "thought bubble".

title.children: 'Brain fart': Basil Zempilas push for WA to host Commonwealth Games slammed

image.altText: A stylised graphic showing two young people, the TikTok logo and two charts

props.synopsis: A new tool created by researchers at the Queensland University of Technology is allowing people to see themselves through the eyes of the algorithm.

title.children: Peering inside his TikTok viewing history, one user finds it is 'not just raw, pointless data'

image.altText: Skye Cusack leans back against a painted brick wall. She is wearing lipstick and smiling.

props.synopsis: After a 12-year relationship ended, I questioned my femininity. But being out of that bubble showed me that being a woman doesn't have to look a certain way.

title.children: Why a break-up was the making of me

image.altText: Steve Coogan crouches above a small penguin, pointing instructively, looking annoyed

props.synopsis: Based on a true story, this heartwarming film stars Steve Coogan as a grumpy English teacher, and a scene-stealing penguin as the one who might just save him.

title.children: Man saves penguin to impress a woman, ends up with a friend for life

image.altText: Andrew Cobby sits in the back of a police car.

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast man who beat his estranged wife with a hammer before choking her to death has lost his bid to have his murder conviction overturned.

title.children: Wife killer to spend life behind bars after judge throws out appeal

image.altText: a woman looks into the camera standing in front of a blue train

props.synopsis: Roni Corne says it used to take a minute to book her ticket with an accessible seat on the NSW regional train network, but now she is required to make a phone call.

title.children: New booking system means Roni has to phone for an hour to get her train seat

image.altText: Senior Constable Kristian White 2024-11-18 11:11:00

props.synopsis: Kristian White was handed a two-year community correction order, which included 425 hours of community service, for fatally tasering 95-year-old Clare Nowland.

title.children: Appeal hearing date set for former NSW Police officer who avoided jail over taser death

image.altText: Pages from the Shein website and from the Temu site

props.synopsis: The two companies said they will be increasing US prices starting April 25 and encouraged shoppers to purchase "now at today's rates".

title.children: Shein, Temu to increase US prices as Trump cracks down on cheap imports

image.altText: A man with bleached hair performs stand-up in front of a mic, wearing a blue velvet jumper with metallic shapes on it.

props.synopsis: Adored by Emma Stone, Tilda Swinton and Julia Fox, Julio Torres is now bringing his surreal comedy to Australia.

title.children: This comedian will make you see colours (and the world) entirely new
